title: Possible bug in KL divergence
body_html:
I think there is a bug in the implementation of KL divergence (torch.nn.KLDivLoss). After getting wrong results, I checked the doc and found the following equation.
loss(x, target) = 1/n \sum(target_i * (log(target_i) - x_i))

But it should be like the following
loss(x, target) = 1/n \sum(target_i * (log(target_i) - log(x_i)))

  • Pytorch version: '0.4.0a0+ff9d1ae'
